typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Permissible: caller is not in the list of Permissibles"

arguments.value: Permissible: caller is not in the list of Permissibles

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Permissible: caller is not in the list of Permissibles"

documentation.text: @dev Throws if called by any account other than any of the Permissibles.

@dev Returns true if the caller is among the list of permitted accounts.
Only allowed for external accounts.
@dev Removes or deactivate the address from the list of permitted accounts.

attributes.text: @dev Throws if called by any account other than any of the Permissibles.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Permissible: caller is not in the list of Permissibles"

attributes.type: literal_string "Permissible: caller is not in the list of Permissibles"
attributes.value: Permissible: caller is not in the list of Permissibles

attributes.text:
@dev Returns true if the caller is among the list of permitted accounts.
Only allowed for external accounts.
@dev Removes or deactivate the address from the list of permitted accounts.

addPermittedAccount(address).details: Adds the address to the list of permitted accounts. Only external accounts should be added. Adding a contract address will not be permitted to do transaction.

isOwner().details: Returns true if the caller is the current owner.

isPermissible().details: Returns true if the caller is among the list of permitted accounts. Only allowed for external accounts.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

removePermittedAccount(address).details: Removes or deactivate the address from the list of permitted accounts.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.      * > Note: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.
